page.title: 15TRANSPORT.
page.content: { Heavy traffic}in York causes problems with fumes,noise,vibration and damage to buildings.Parking is difficult.The easiest way to get around York is by bicycle.There are several{bridges over {the river},Ouse,Lendal,Skeldergate, Scarborough and Clifton.Trains have used Scarborough Bridge since 1845.Clifton Bridge is the most recent,built in 1963 to take traffic away from the city centre.(Before then there was a ferry over the river.)In a non busy period, 871 vehicles passed in half an hour. {York Railway Station}was built before the First World War but was soon bombed and quickly repaired.It formed an important part of the Great Eastern Railway.York was and still is one the biggest and busiest station in Great Britain with sixteen platforms and an information centre.
